charTools

Various string helper tools that is sometimes used repeatedly

Summary
charToolsVarious string helper tools that is sometimes used repeatedly
Functions
newCloneCreates a “new” clone of the input char
toBoolConverts the char* to its bool value for cases of 1/0, true/false, yes/no, or part thereof.
_toBoolConverts the char* to its int “bool” value for cases of 1/0, true/false, yes/no, or part thereof.
toLongConverts the char* to base 10 long value if possible : this is an inline referance to std strtol
charTools::cmpo_lesscmpo_less = strcmp operators less

Functions

newClone

char* charTools::newClone(const char *inChar)

Creates a “new” clone of the input char

toBool

bool charTools::toBool(const char *inChar,
bool defaultBool)

Converts the char* to its bool value for cases of 1/0, true/false, yes/no, or part thereof.

Parameters

const char* inCharinput char* to check
bool defaultBoolbool value to output, if no pattern matches

_toBool

int_fast8_t charTools::_toBool(const char *inChar)

Converts the char* to its int “bool” value for cases of 1/0, true/false, yes/no, or part thereof.  Note that this varient, is useful when failure / nomatch is an option.

Parameters

const char* inCharinput char* to check

Returns

0Failed to match any bool value pattern
1True pattern matched
-1False pattern matched

toLong

long charTools::toLong(const char *inChar)

Converts the char* to base 10 long value if possible : this is an inline referance to std strtol

Parameters

const char* inCharinput char* to check

Returns

0No valid value / Is really 0
LONG_MAXMaximum long value, due to out-of-bound char value
LONG_MINMinimum long value, due to out-of-bound char value

charTools::cmpo_less

bool const charTools::cmpo_less::operator() (const char* lhs, const char* rhs)

cmpo_less = strcmp operators less

Useful comparision operator that can be used for maps.

Example

std::map<char*,char*, charTools::cmpo_less> charsMap
